Tizen: Linux Foundation  Tizen Association  Samsung  Intel
Sailfish OS: Sailfish Alliance  Mer  Jolla and Sailfish community contributors

Android: Base system is Free and open-source  but usually bundled with proprietary apps and drivers  which provide an increasing amount of the functionality.[11]
Windows 10 Mobile: Proprietary except for open source components
Tizen: Partial; both proprietary and open-source components  assorted licenses
Sailfish OS: Free and open-source  but the UI and the SDK are proprietary and closed source
Ubuntu Touch: Free and open-source  mainly the GPL[12]
Plasma Mobile: Free and open-source  mainly the GPL
PureOS: Free and open-source  mainly the GPL
KaiOS: Proprietary except for open source kernel patches (formerly the MPL 2.0 B2G OS)

Android: ARM (32-bit ARMv7-A and 64-bit ARMv8-A only)  x86  x86-64[13]

Windows 10 Mobile: 7+: XNA (.NET C#)  Silverlight  native C/C++ (only for vendors and partners[14]) 8+: .NET C#  VB.NET  Silverlight  native C/C++  WinRTP (XMLA)  DirectX
BlackBerry 10: C/ C++: Native SDK  C++/Qt: Cascades SDK  HTML5/Javascript/CSS: Webworks SDK  ActionScript: Adobe AIR  Java: Android runtime
Ubuntu Touch: Apps: HTML5  QML  Go  JavaScript  C++ System: C  C++  QML

Android: No[27] since Android 4.1[28] and Android 4.3[29] and more restrictions on Android 4.4[30]
